ranking.title: SCALE
ranking.description_part1: This leaderboard evaluates the SQL capabilities of major large language models. For more details, check out our
ranking.full_description: The Large Model SQL Capability Leaderboard (SCALE) reveals the true proficiency of large models in SQL. SCALE comprehensively evaluates Large Language Models' (LLMs) core SQL capabilities through scientific, rigorous assessment, focusing on three critical dimensions: SQL Optimization (enhancing query efficiency and performance), Dialect Conversion (enabling seamless cross-database platform migration), and Deep SQL Comprehension (accurately parsing complex logic and user intent). To authentically reflect real-world database operation performance, we established a multi-dimensional, multi-metric evaluation system employing strict testing with real-world cases across varying difficulty levels. Each test case carries scientifically calibrated weights based on technical complexity and practical value (higher difficulty = greater weight), ensuring final scores precisely measure models' comprehensive performance in high-value, high-challenge tasks. Through rigorous testing and weighted scoring, SCALE provides developers, database administrators, and enterprise technology decision-makers with authoritative, objective benchmarks, clearly delineating models' relative strengths in SQL processing to advance intelligent database application development and implementation.

evaluation_cases.title: Evaluation Case Report
evaluation_cases.no_data_found: No evaluation case data found for this dimension.

basic_elements.title: Basic Elements
basic_elements.item1: Each ability contains multiple evaluation indicators
basic_elements.item2: Each indicator contains multiple test cases
basic_elements.item3: Each case has a difficulty level (1-3)

weight_settings.title: Weight Settings
weight_settings.item1: Indicator Weight: Reflects importance (higher = more important)

scoring_steps.title: Scoring Steps
scoring_steps.item1: Case Score = Difficulty Weight √ó Correctness (1 for correct, 0 for wrong)
scoring_steps.item2: Indicator Score = Sum of all case scores in the indicator
scoring_steps.item3: Total Ability Score = ‚àë(Indicator Score √ó Indicator Weight)
scoring_steps.item4: Max Possible Score = ‚àë(Sum of case difficulty weights per indicator √ó Indicator Weight)
scoring_steps.item5: Final Ability Score = (Total Ability Score √∑ Max Possible Score) √ó 100

special_cases.title: Special Cases
special_cases.item2: Indicators without configured weights are excluded

example.title: Example
example.item1: Indicator A (weight 4): 3 cases (difficulty 1/2/3 all correct) ‚Üí Indicator Score= 1√ó1 + 2√ó1 + 3√ó1 = 6
example.item2: Indicator B (weight 2): 2 cases (difficulty 2/3 all correct) ‚Üí Indicator Score= 2√ó1 + 3√ó1 = 5

submission_guide.title: Submission Guidelines
submission_guide.intro: We welcome community contributions! To ensure the quality and consistency of the leaderboard, please follow these guidelines when submitting your model's evaluation report.
submission_guide.req1: Report Integrity: All three reports generated by the evaluator must be submitted in full and the evaluation time (model score report, case run report, evaluation process report) must be stated in the PR.
submission_guide.req2: Complete Model Configuration: The model configuration in `llm_config.py` under `TARGET_LLM_CONFIG` must be complete, including all display-related fields.
submission_guide.req3: Standard Datasets: If using our standard dataset, you must perform a full evaluation across all three dimensions and all indicators.
submission_guide.req4: Custom Datasets: If using a custom dataset, ensure it follows the required format. A full evaluation across all three dimensions and indicators is still required.
submission_guide.req5: No Duplicate Models: We do not accept model evaluation reports that are already on the ranking list for the month you are evaluating the model.
submission_guide.req6: Further Reading: For detailed instructions on using the evaluator and other information, please refer to the `README.md` in our GitHub repository.
